info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 5:02PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL PULASKI...SOUTHWESTERN FLOYD...EASTERN CARROLL AND NORTHWESTERN PATRICK COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 501 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sylvatus, or near Patterson, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Hillsville... Woolwine... Willis... Fancy Gap... Dugspur... Laurel Fork... and Meadows Of Dan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
